description.p: *NOTE*: This is an inofficial Flatpak repackaging of the official release of Camunda Modeler.

Camunda Modeler is a low-code visual designer tool to model, connect, and prepare your BPMN business processes for execution. Using standards like BPMN and DMN, you can align IT and business with a common model and language. The result is better, more efficient workflows, delivered faster.

li.p: You can now create and store multiple connections using the settings, and easily switch between connections from the status bar.

Element templates now support templating timer events, enabling reusable timer configuration across processes. If an applied template is missing in the current configuration, its ID and version are displayed in the Template section of the properties panel for easier troubleshooting.
The Modeler now helps ensure you have the right IO mappings for the Camunda version you're using.
The incident error message is now displayed in a readable format. Task testing supports process applications, and uses the configured tenant ID if provided.
As always, this release incorporates bug fixes and additional minor improvements.
You can now configure a script task as a FEEL expression, define the called decision of a business rule task, and configure a form linked to a user task.
Our FEEL editor now supports escaping variable names with backticks. We've improved support for the Camunda dialect, ensuring that all built-in functions are now fully recognized.
The Modeler now helps ensure you have the right IO mappings for the Camunda version you're using.
You can now add custom error messages to form inputs validated with regex patterns.
As always, this release incorporates bug fixes and additional minor improvements.
Camunda 8.7 and 7.23 are now fully supported. Also, you can now configure completion attributes of ad-hoc subprocesses.
We now support process applications and resource linking. You can use process applications to easily group processes, decisions, and forms in a project, and link them.
Edit, test and deploy Robotic Process Automation (RPA) scripts with the new RPA editor.
As always, this release incorporates bug fixes and additional minor improvements.
C8 OAuth connection with custom audience
You can now create diagrams for Camunda 8.8. We also added support for an updating user task listener.
We improved our validation of Camunda 8 ad-hoc subprocesses. Additionally, the modeler now recognizes documentation URLs provided by linter plug-ins.
Find elements using Camunda-specific search terms. Change the type of an event without losing its implementation details.
As always, this release incorporates bug fixes and additional minor improvements.
You can now model an Ad-hoc subprocess and define its active elements.

p.b: Support for latest Camunda 8 FEEL built-ins

li.p: The FEEL expression editor now supports the latest built-in functions.
As always, this release incorporates bug fixes and additional minor improvements.
